(on loan from [[Everton F.C.|Everton]]) | clubnumber = 68 | youthyears1 = 2005–2014 | youthclubs1 = [[Barnsley F.C.|Barnsley]] | years1 = 2014–2015 | clubs1 = [[Barnsley F.C.|Barnsley]] | caps1 = 20 | goals1 = 1 | years2 = 2015– | clubs2 = [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] | caps2 = 38 | goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2019– | clubs3 = → [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] (loan) | caps3 = 6 | goals3 = 0 | nationalyears1 = 2015–2016 | nationalteam1 = [[England national under-20 football team|England U20]] | nationalcaps1 = 8 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2016– | nationalteam2 = [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]] | nationalcaps2 = 6 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | club-update = 19:21, 19 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 17:52, 1 July 2017 (UTC) }} '''Mason Anthony Holgate''' (born 22 October 1996) is an English professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[centre back]] for [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] of the [[EFL Championship|Championship]], on loan from {{English football updater|Everton}} club [[Everton F.C.|Everton]], and the [[England national under-21 football team|England under-21 team]]. He can also operate as a [[right back]]. ==Club career== ===Barnsley=== Holgate was born in [[Doncaster]], [[South Yorkshire]] and joined [[Barnsley F.C.|Barnsley]] at the age of nine.{{cite web|url=http://www.barnsleyfc.co.uk/news/article/reds-youngster-mason-holgate-signs-professional-contract-1961514.aspx|title=Reds Youngster Mason Holgate Signs Professional Contract|publisher=Barnsley F.C.|date=25 August 2014|accessdate=18 August 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140927042905/http://www.barnsleyfc.co.uk/news/article/reds-youngster-mason-holgate-signs-professional-contract-1961514.aspx|archivedate=27 September 2014 |deadurl=no}} Having progressed through the club's academy and reserve team, Holgate signed his first professional contract, keeping him at Barnsley until 2016. He made his [[Football League One|League One]] debut for Barnsley on 2 December 2014, playing the full ninety minutes of a 1–1 draw with [[Doncaster Rovers F.C.|Doncaster Rovers]] at [[Oakwell]].{{cite news|title=Barnsley 1 – 1 Doncaster|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28993024|accessdate=25 January 2015|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|date=2 December 2014}} Following this, the club were determined to negotiate a longer term contract for Holgate. After inclusion in the first team, Holgate scored his first Barnsley goal, in a 5–0 win over [[Rochdale A.F.C.|Rochdale]] on the last game of the season.{{cite news|title=Barnsley 5 – 0 Rochdale|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/32471219|publisher=BBC Sport|date=3 May 2015|accessdate=18 August 2015}} Following a successful [[2014–15 Barnsley F.C. season|debut season]] at Barnsley, Holgate was named 2014–15 Young Player of the Year.{{cite web|url=http://www.barnsleyfc.co.uk/news/article/top-awards-for-hourihane-winnall-nyatanga-2440652.aspx|title=Top Awards for Hourihane, Winnall & Nyatanga|publisher=Barnsley F.C.|date=5 May 2015|accessdate=18 August 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150507211430/http://www.barnsleyfc.co.uk/news/article/top-awards-for-hourihane-winnall-nyatanga-2440652.aspx|archivedate=7 May 2015 |deadurl=no}} In addition to this award, press speculation linked Holgate with a number of [[Premier League]] clubs; {{cite news|title=Mason Holgate: Barnsley aim to tie teenager to new deal|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30624830|accessdate=25 January 2015|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|date=29 December 2014}} in July 2015, he went on trial at [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]].[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3162955/Manchester-United-hand-trial-Barnsley-defender-Mason-Holgate.html "Manchester United hand trial to Barnsley defender Mason Holgate in bid to ward off interest from Aston Villa and Swansea"] Daily Mail. 15 July 2015. Retrieved 17 July 2015.{{Unreliable source|date=September 2018}} ===Everton=== On 13 August 2015 Holgate signed a five-year deal to join Premier League side [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] for a reported fee of £2 million.{{Cite web|title = Blues Complete Holgate Deal {{!}} Everton Football Club|url = http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2015/08/13/blues-complete-holgate-deal|publisher = Everton F.C.|accessdate = 2015-08-13}}{{cite web|last1=Whalley|first1=Mike|title=Everton sign Mason Holgate from Barnsley on five-year contract|url=http://www.espnfc.com/story/2561755/everton-sign-mason-holgate-from-barnsley|publisher=[[ESPN FC]]|accessdate=13 August 2015|date=13 August 2015}} On 13 August 2016, a year after he signed for the club, Holgate made his Premier League debut in the 1–1 draw with Tottenham Hotspur in the [[Premier League]]. ====West Bromwich Albion (loan)==== On 31 December 2018, Holgate joined [[EFL Championship|Championship]] side [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] on loan until the end of the [[2018–19 EFL Championship|season]].{{Cite web|title = Albion add first January recruit|url = https://www.wba.co.uk/news/2018/december/albion-add-first-january-recruit/|publisher = West Bromwich Albion F.C.|accessdate = 2018-12-31}} ==International career== Holgate is of Jamaican descent through his grandparents, and is eligible to represent both England and Jamaica internationally.{{cite web|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2017/03/22/yorkshire-blue|title=Yorkshire Blue - Everton Football Club|publisher=Everton F.C.}} Holgate was the starting right back for [[England national under-21 football team|England under-21]] during the [[2017 UEFA European Under-21 Championship]] in June 2017.{{cite web|url=https://www.whoscored.com/Players/297544/Show/Mason-Holgate|title=Mason Holgate|publisher=Whoscored.com}} ==Career statistics== {{updated|match played 17
